portal_hypertension.title: Percutaneous Radiofrequency Ablation of Perivascular versus Nonperivascular Hepatocellular Carcinomas ≤3 cm: Local Tumor Progression and Survival in an Inverse Probability of Treatment Weighting Analysis.
portal_hypertension.journal: Journal of vascular and interventional radiology : JVIR
portal_hypertension.authors: Kim J, Kim JH, Lee SJ
portal_hypertension.zhSummary: 该文聚焦门静脉高压症，属于临床研究。核心观点：旨在确定经皮射频消融 (RFA) 后血管周围肝细胞癌 (HCC) 是否与非血管周围肝细胞癌 (HCC) 较高的局部肿瘤进展 (LTP) 和较低的总生存期 (OS) 相关。 临床提示：这项回顾性研究纳入了 2005 年 1 月至 2020 年 12 月期间连续接受 RFA 治疗的 650 名未经治疗的单发小（≤3 cm）HCC 患者。
portal_hypertension.abstract: To determine whether perivascular hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) is associated with higher local tumor progression (LTP) and lower overall survival (OS) after percutaneous radiofrequency ablation (RFA) than nonperivascular HCC. This retrospective study included consecutive 650 treatment-naive patients with a single small (≤3 cm) HCC treated with RFA between January 2005 and December 2020. Tumors were categorized as perivascular if the index lesion directly contacted a first- or second-order branch of the portal or hepatic vein ≥3 mm in diameter; otherwise, they were considered nonperivascular. portal_hypertension.title: Cirrhotic cardiomyopathy: pathophysiology, assessment, and implications for liver transplantation.
portal_hypertension.authors: Gill M, Koshy AN, Ramachandran J
portal_hypertension.zhSummary: 该文聚焦门静脉高压症，属于综述研究。核心观点：肝硬化心肌病（CCM）是晚期慢性肝病患者心功能障碍的一种独特形式，定义为亚临床舒张功能障碍，以及在不存在原发性心脏病的情况下较少见的收缩功能障碍。 临床提示：该实体反映了肝硬化心脏的结构、功能和生化改变之间的动态相互作用，加上门静脉高压和炎症的全身影响。
portal_hypertension.abstract: Cirrhotic cardiomyopathy (CCM) is a distinct form of cardiac dysfunction in patients with advanced chronic liver disease, defined by subclinical diastolic impairment and, less commonly, systolic dysfunction, in the absence of primary cardiac disease. The entity reflects a dynamic interplay between structural, functional, and biochemical alterations in the cirrhotic heart, compounded by the systemic effects of portal hypertension and inflammation. Recent advances in diagnostic criteria, most notably the 2020 CCM Consortium (CCC-2020) definitions, have refined diagnostics and aligned CCM with contemporary concepts of heart failure (HF).
